data.title: Word occurrences
data.statement:
You have to get the count of case insensitive occurrences for the given word in all sentences (strictly on its own, not as part of another word).

You also have to return the number of sentences having at least one occurrence of this word. 

<<Warning :>> [[word]] contains letters in the English alphabet and may contain {{_}}. 
Punctuations are ignored when counting words.

testCases.title: simple case
testCases.testIn:
hello
2
i say hello
you say good bye

testCases.title: Validator 2
testCases.testIn:
good
3
i say Hello
you say good bye
you say good bye

testCases.title: many occurrences
testCases.testIn:
more
4
The more you do, the more you fail. 
The more you fail, the more you learn.
The more you learn, the better you get.
John C. Maxwell

testCases.title: Validator 3
testCases.testIn:
less
4
The less you do, the less you fail. 
The less you fail, the less you learn.
The more you learn, the better you get.
John C. Maxwell

testCases.title: special chars
testCases.testIn:
hello
3
I say hello.
You say good bye.
Hello dear friend.

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn:
hello
3
I say, hello!
You say, good bye!
Hello, dear friend!

testCases.title: the exact word
testCases.testIn:
Car
6
Be carefull of my car behind.
I dont care if you read it.
My little flower is rasing up.
He's a lovely boy, very helpful and caring.
Why am i so dependant of my car?
Car is a vehicle.

testCases.title: Validator 5
testCases.testIn:
Be
6
Be carefull of my car behind.
I dont care if you read it.
Be the best you can be.
He's a lovely boy, very helpful and caring.
Why am i so dependant of my bee?
Be or not a bee.

testCases.title: Test 6
testCases.testIn:
word
96
Joe waited for the train.
Mary and Samantha arrived at the bus station early but waited until noon for the bus.
A Word Can Be Used in a Sentence Many Ways.
Sometimes to understand a word's meaning you need more than a definition.
Simply type in the word you want to explore the meaning of and find your screen filled with countless examples of that word in a sentence.
If you want to hear how the word is said, we can assist with that too. 
Just click on the speaker icon at the top of the page to listen to a clear pronunciation of the word.
Just type one word after another word and you get a sentence.
Joe waited for the train.
Mary and Samantha arrived at the bus station early but waited until noon for the bus.

testCases.title: no occurrences
testCases.testIn:
butterfly
2
I go to the swimming pool.
I leave in London.

testCases.title: Validator 7
testCases.testIn:
lion
2
I hate going to the swimming pool.
I leave in Paris.

testCases.title: underscore
testCases.testIn:
snake_case
2
snake_case is a word's nomenclature separating each one with _ (it look like a snake)
Don't be a snake

testCases.title: Validator 8
testCases.testIn:
_
2
snake_case is a word's nomenclature separating each one with _ (it look like a snake)
Don't be a snake man _

testCases.title: camelCase
testCases.testIn:
camelCase
2
camel case is written camelCase in camel case
CamelCase is not written in camel case

testCases.title: Validator 9
testCases.testIn:
PascalCase
2
pascal case is written PascalCase in pascal case
pascalCase is not written in pascalcase

data.stubGenerator:
read word:string(50)
read n:int
loop n read sentence:string(1024)
write nbOccurrences nbSentencesWithOccurrences
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1 :>> The word to search [[word]]
<<Line 2 :>> An integer [[n]] corresponding to the number of sentences below
<<Next>> [[n]]<< lines :>> the given sentences
data.outputDescription: A line with two integers (space separated) [[nbOccurrences]] [[nbSentencesWithOccurrences]]

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You have to get the count of case insensitive occurrences for the given word in all sentences (strictly on its own, not as part of another word).

You also have to return the number of sentences having at least one occurrence of this word.

Warning : word contains letters in the English alphabet and may contain _.
Punctuations are ignored when counting words.
Input
Line 1 : The word to search word
Line 2 : An integer n corresponding to the number of sentences below
Next n lines : the given sentences
Output
A line with two integers (space separated) nbOccurrences nbSentencesWithOccurrences
Constraints
0 < n < 100
word length is between 1 and 50
Example
Input
example
1
Here a poor example.
Output
1 1
